Re: License #: CO390201216
Dear Peter Holt:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
3/1/2023 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
COF Rule 400.10113 Employee records
(1) Employee records shall be maintained for each
employee and shall include all of the following
information: (f) A written evaluation of the employee's
performance within the first 6 months of each position
designated by these rules and annually thereafter.

Six of seventeen employee files reviewed did not have the required written
evaluations completed appropriately. Three of these involve new employees who
had evaluations completed after the required time frames. Two of the long-term
employee files reviewed had late evaluations and one had no evidence of the
evaluation occurring.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

V. CONSULTATION

• No consultation was requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review with the exception of the CAP for the interim inspection last
year. The CAP involved youth reports being ocmpleted late and this was not found
during this inspection.
Financial Overview
Financial items were reviewed, and no concerns were found.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff interviewed reported the administration is supportive of their efforts to
provide care for the youth. They also reported receiving adequate training. All
youth reported feelings safe and supervised by the staff.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a two-story cinder block building in excellent repair. There is ample
space for the youth. The menu was present, and it appears the youth are being
provided a variety of appropriate food choices. All fire extinguishers were up to
date and cleaning items were locked. Bedding was appropriate and all toilets,
sinks, and showers had both hot and cold running water with appropriate drainage.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
